entries.title: Initial build — complete architecture from scratch
entries.description: Built the entire dev-track system in one session: server, UI, CLI, data layer, integrations, AI brain, codebase scanner.
files_changed: 79 files total across server/, ui/, cli/, shared/, data/, templates/

entries.title: First boot — UI renders successfully in browser
entries.description: Fixed all configuration issues preventing the UI from rendering. All 11 views confirmed working in Chrome.

entries.title: GitHub repo created and code pushed
entries.description: Created public GitHub repo and pushed all code.

entries.title: Cursor rule cold-start fix — AI orients on every new conversation
entries.description: Added cold-start instructions to cursor rule so the AI reads context-recovery, session state, and project health on the very first message.

entries.title: TypeScript build passes clean
entries.description: Fixed TS build error: 'standard' was not a valid Verbosity type in store.ts defaults. npm run build now passes for both UI and server.

entries.title: Archive/completed sections with reopen for Backlog and Issues
entries.description: Completed items no longer vanish. Backlog has a collapsible Completed section at the bottom with reopen buttons. Issues has a reopen button for resolved items.

entries.title: GitHub integration rewritten — zero config via local git + gh CLI
entries.description: Replaced the PAT-only GitHub integration with a local-first approach. Layer 1: local git CLI for commit history, branches, diffs (zero config). Layer 2: gh CLI for PRs and CI (zero config if authenticated). Layer 3: PAT as optional fallback.

entries.title: Cursor rule redesigned — inline briefing replaces cold-start file reads
entries.description: The Quick Status and Last Session Briefing are now baked directly into the cursor rule file. AI sees context immediately without reading any files. Works for any AI platform.

entries.title: Standing Instructions — persistent micro-instructions across AI platforms
entries.description: Added a Standing Instructions section to the cursor rule for behavioral preferences like 'restart servers for me' that persist across conversations and platforms. Instructions live in both the context file and brain/preferences.json.

entries.title: Interactive codebase architecture visualizer with react-flow
entries.description: Built a full graph visualization for the Codebase Explorer. Three views (Module Architecture, File Dependencies, API Route Map), custom nodes, edge tooltips, click-to-highlight, detail panel with layman-friendly descriptions.

entries.title: Codebase scanner — generic module inference replaces Next.js-specific logic
entries.description: The inferModules function was hardcoded for Next.js (lib/, components/, app/api/). Rewrote it to work with any project structure by grouping files by their actual directory paths. Also improved file classification to recognize Hono routes and React views.

entries.title: Plain-English module descriptions for architecture graph
entries.description: Rewrote scanner to generate rich, human-readable descriptions for every module instead of just '8 files, 3 functions'. Descriptions explain what each module does based on its file types, exports, external services, and DB operations. Added shortDescription for graph node display.

entries.title: Relationship labels on graph edges
entries.description: Inter-module edges now show plain-English relationship descriptions ('uses UI components from', 'reads and writes project data', 'renders pages from') instead of '3 imports'. Labels appear on hover and persist when edges are highlighted.

entries.title: Rich module detail panel with descriptions and connections
entries.description: Clicking a module node now shows a full detail panel with: plain-English description, stats, file type breakdown, key exports, connection list with relationship descriptions, and external services. Replaced the old 'click into files' placeholder.

entries.title: Docs view complete overhaul — proper markdown wiki
entries.description: Replaced raw pre-tag markdown dump with a full wiki experience: rendered markdown (react-markdown + remark-gfm), file sidebar with sorted navigation, auto-generated table of contents with click-to-scroll, proper heading styles, code blocks, tables, blockquotes, and full-width layout.

entries.title: AI-in-the-loop foundation: multi-provider service, model router, 25-tool registry
entries.description: Built the complete AI backbone: AIService with unified interface across OpenAI (GPT-5.2/5.3-Codex), Anthropic (Opus 4.6/Sonnet 4.5/Haiku), and Google (Gemini 3 Pro/Flash). Task-aware ModelRouter with fallback chains. Helicone proxy for cost tracking. 25 tools giving the AI full read/write access to backlog, issues, changelog, ideas, codebase, git, docs, brain, state, metrics, and project files.

entries.title: AI chat sidebar: persistent resizable panel with streaming and tool call rendering
entries.description: Built the chat-first AI interface as a persistent right sidebar. Resizable (320-700px drag handle), push layout, model selector dropdown, conversation thread management, SSE streaming with real-time text + tool call events, markdown message rendering, tool call pills with expandable details, suggested prompts for new conversations.

entries.title: AI configuration: data schema, user profiles, feature flags, budget controls
entries.description: Created data/ai/ directory with config.json (provider settings, feature flags, budget limits, model defaults), profiles.json (user profile with technical attributes, communication style, AI instructions), usage.json (cost tracking). Credentials stored in .credentials.json (gitignored).

entries.title: Auto-model-discovery from provider APIs
entries.description: Router now queries Anthropic models.list(), OpenAI models.list(), and Google on startup to auto-discover available models. Pattern-based tier classification (opus=premium, sonnet=standard, haiku=budget) means model name changes never break routing again. Found 58 models across 3 providers.

entries.title: Docs ToC filtering for long documents
entries.description: Fixed ToC sidebar in Docs view flooding with repetitive entries from SPEC. Now filters to h1-h2 only when document has >15 headings. Also skips headings inside code blocks.

entries.title: Fix duplicate AI chat messages
entries.description: Fixed bug where every AI response appeared twice in chat. Both 'message_complete' and 'done' SSE events were adding the message. Now only 'message_complete' adds, and accContent is cleared to prevent double-add.

entries.title: Fix chat resize, model picker, and conversation persistence
entries.description: Fixed resize handle not working (missing e.preventDefault()), model picker race condition (retry when discovery incomplete), conversation persistence across refresh (localStorage), deduplicated model list (58→~15 unique), added conversation delete button, grouped models by provider in dropdown.

entries.title: Fix stale brain notes on dashboard (ISS-009)
entries.description: Dismissed superseded brain notes (BN-003 open source decision replaced by BN-013 paid product, BN-007/BN-008 already actioned). Added superseded_by field. Dashboard now shows only current, relevant AI insights.

entries.title: UI overhaul: Lucide icons, Cursor-minimal design
entries.description: Replaced all emoji icons with Lucide React SVG icons across Sidebar, Dashboard, Ideas, Codebase, Sessions. Redesigned sidebar with grouped navigation sections, tighter spacing, branded logo mark. Redesigned dashboard with clean card components, proper icon system, minimal aesthetic inspired by Cursor/Linear.

entries.title: Settings page redesign with Profile, AI Config, and Integrations tabs
entries.description: Rebuilt Settings page with Cursor-inspired sidebar nav. Three sections: Profile (experience web with sliders, behavior patterns, AI instructions, context notes), AI Configuration (providers, default models with grouped dropdowns, budget controls, feature toggles), and Integrations (existing, cleaned up). Added GET/PUT /ai/profile server endpoints. Expanded user profile schema with behavior patterns (session length, context habits, closure prompting, communication pace).

entries.title: AI-observed profile with intelligence scoring and radar charts
entries.description: Replaced self-reported profile sliders with AI-observed scoring. Added: IQ-scale intelligence score (128) with ring visualization, cognitive profile radar chart (systems thinking, product intuition, pattern recognition, learning velocity, strategic reasoning, communication, technical abstraction, attention to detail), technical skills radar chart (coding, architecture, design, product, devops, data, security, testing). AI assessment notes. All read-only, dynamically updateable. Custom SVG RadarChart component (zero deps). ISS-010 resolved.

entries.title: Notification tray with toast notifications and bell panel
entries.description: Built real-time notification system: toast notifications (auto-dismiss 5s, slide-in animation, max 3 visible), notification bell in header with unread count badge, dropdown panel with full notification history (mark read, clear all). WebSocket file_changed events converted to typed notifications. Dedupe logic for rapid-fire events. Top bar added to App layout. ISS-011 resolved.

entries.title: Issue tracking discipline — create before fix
entries.description: Established discipline of creating ISS-XXX entries BEFORE fixing bugs, not after. ISS-010 (profile self-reporting), ISS-011 (no notifications), ISS-012 (no conversation bridge) all created before work started. This is the first layer of ISS-006 fix — the structural enforcement (session-end audit) is the second layer.

entries.title: Deep cross-project intelligence assessment
entries.description: Audited all 4 projects (Pillar 919 files, Landmark 323 files, Seat-at-Table ~200 files, dev-track ~100 files) plus chat logs, brain notes, session history, and preferences. Built comprehensive cognitive profile: IQ 131 (revised up from 128), 12 detailed assessment notes, deep assessment with cognitive strengths/weaknesses, work style profile, IQ calibration methodology. Added deep assessment display to Settings UI with strengths, growth areas, work style grid, and calibration notes.

entries.title: AI-to-AI operational guidance and session observation pipeline
entries.description: Added ai_to_ai_guidance section to user profile — blunt operational instructions for any AI working with this user. Includes: handling calibration (explanation depth, vocabulary, response length, disagreement style), common failure modes (scope explosion, context burnout, forgetting tracking, sugarcoating, over-planning), what he values, what loses trust, intelligence calibration for AI. Added session_observations array for session-end observation pipeline. Updated cursor rule with session-end observation instruction. Captured IDEA-029.

entries.title: Fix radar chart labels, add observation log UI, sharpen AI-to-AI honesty
entries.description: Fixed radar chart label clipping (increased padding, SVG overflow visible, shortened chart labels while keeping full labels in score grid). Added session observation log display to profile UI showing raw AI-to-AI observations with attribute signals. Sharpened ai_to_ai_guidance with 3 new failure modes (VALIDATION THEATER, FLATTERY TRAP, IDEA SEDUCTION) and 3 new assessment notes (testing blind spot pattern, meta-work seduction risk, emotional volatility management).

entries.title: Honest assessment overhaul — no more softening
entries.description: Expanded AI observations from 4 visible to all (collapsible). Changed 'Growth Areas' to 'Weaknesses' in UI. Added brutally honest assessment notes: cannot code independently, idea generation outpaces execution, vision clarity != communication clarity, Jobs/Woz dynamic, deep distrust of validation, meta-work seduction trap. Lowered attention to detail from 5 to 4. Expanded cognitive weaknesses from 5 to 6 with more operational language. Updated ai_to_ai explanation calibration (he reads detailed plans, just not preambles). Captured IDEA-030 (portable intelligence profile).

entries.title: Dashboard overhaul v2 + profile actionable targets, comparisons, AI dependency
entries.description: Dashboard rebuilt: health ring visualization, compact stats row, collapsible AI briefing, horizontal brain note cards, 3/2 column split (focus+pipeline | activity+changelog+ideas), 'Up Next' pipeline, 'Recently Shipped' changelog. Profile: added actionable development targets with specific advice, comparative framing (vs engineers/founders/AI power users + archetype), AI dependency estimates with progress bars. Intelligence score corrected to 127 with strategy context on testing tradeoffs.

entries.title: Kanban drag-and-drop (ISS-004 resolved)
entries.description: Wired up @dnd-kit/core in Backlog.tsx. DndContext wrapper, useDroppable columns keyed by horizon, useDraggable cards, DragOverlay with card preview, PointerSensor with 8px activation distance so clicks still work. Drop zone highlighting (blue ring on hover, dashed outline during drag). Button-based moves kept as fallback.

entries.title: AI provider API key management in Settings UI
entries.description: Added API Keys card to Settings > AI Configuration. Password inputs with show/hide toggle for OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and Helicone. Masked key display on load. Save button calls PUT /api/v1/ai/credentials. Per-provider Test Connection button calls new POST /api/v1/ai/providers/:id/test endpoint that verifies keys by attempting API calls (list models for OpenAI, minimal message for Anthropic, generate for Google, query for Helicone). Inline pass/fail results.

entries.title: Multi-project distribution architecture — dogfood-ready
entries.description: Major refactor: all server files now use centralized project-config.ts instead of hardcoded process.cwd()/data paths. Created ~/.dev-track/ central registry with per-project data directories. CLI commands: 'dev-track init' scaffolds a new project (.dev-track/config.json in project, data at ~/.dev-track/projects/<id>/data/, cursor rule from template, gitignore update, project registry). 'dev-track start' launches server with correct data dir and project root. 'dev-track projects' lists all registered projects. Server accepts --data-dir, --port, --project-root flags. New endpoints: GET /api/v1/project (current project info), GET /api/v1/projects (all registered). Sidebar shows project name prominently with 'dev-track' as subtle branding below. Tested: Pillar initialized successfully with isolated data, server boots clean pointing at Pillar data.

entries.title: Consolidate API keys into Integrations tab (ISS-013 resolved)
entries.description: Moved all AI provider API key management (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Helicone) from AI Configuration tab into Integrations tab as a top-level 'AI Providers' section. 2x2 grid layout with per-provider key input, show/hide toggle, and Test Connection button. AI Configuration tab now only contains: provider enable/disable toggles (with cross-reference to Integrations for key setup), model defaults, budget controls, and feature toggles. Added 'Development Tools' subheader to separate AI providers from integration plugins below.

entries.title: In-app project switcher with hot-swap (ISS-014 resolved)
entries.description: Built project switcher dropdown in sidebar header. When multiple projects are registered, a chevron appears next to the project name. Click opens a dropdown showing all registered projects with names, paths, and active indicator. POST /api/v1/projects/switch endpoint hot-swaps the data directory, project root, reloads the Store, and restarts the file watcher — all without restarting the server process. Watcher made restartable (closes old chokidar instance, starts new one on new data dir). Page reloads after switch to refresh all cached view data.

entries.title: Remove Helicone from AI Providers section — lives in Dev Tools only
entries.description: Removed Helicone from the AI Providers grid in Integrations tab. Helicone has its own full plugin entry in Dev Tools below with proper credential fields (including org ID). AI Providers section now shows only the 3 direct AI providers: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google in a 3-column grid.

entries.title: Helicone org ID field + credential sync to AI proxy (ISS-015 resolved)
entries.description: Added Organization ID credential field to Helicone integration plugin. Updated IntegrationManager to sync Helicone credentials (api_key → ai.helicone, org_id → ai.helicone_org_id) to the AI proxy namespace when saved. Users now configure Helicone in one place (Integrations tab) and the AI proxy automatically picks up the key and org ID for routing requests through Helicone. Captured IDEA-031 (encrypted key transfer for cross-project credential sharing).

entries.title: Modular AI tool registry — 40 tools across 16 domains (ISS-016 resolved)
entries.description: Replaced monolithic tools.ts (718-line switch statement) with a modular registry at server/ai/tools/. 16 domain modules: backlog, issues, changelog, ideas, state, brain, session, actions, codebase, git, files, docs, metrics, config, profiles, integrations. Each module is self-contained (definitions + executors in one file). Registry auto-collects all tools from all modules. ~40 total tools. New capabilities added: update_project_state, update_idea, start/end_session, Actions full CRUD, context_recovery read/write, preferences read/write, user_profile read/write + add_session_observation, write_project_file, list_directory, scan_codebase (trigger fresh scan), detailed git_log (full messages, dates, since/path filters), git_branches, update_velocity, project_config read/write, list_registered_projects, get_integrations_status, test_integration. Adding new tools = create new file in tools/ directory and add to MODULES array.

entries.title: Fix Changelog crash, Ideas click bug, Docs ToC scroll (ISS-017/018/019)
entries.description: Changelog: added null safety on entry.items and entry.files_touched, helper for files_changed/files_touched field name mismatch, added type/scope display. Ideas: added optional chaining on all array accesses (pros, cons, open_questions). Docs: fixed ToC scroll to use container-relative offset instead of scrollIntoView (which fails in nested overflow containers).

entries.title: Entity Model v2 - complete type system, data migration, store, routes, tools, and UI refactor
entries.description: 14 entity types defined. Data migrated (backlog to roadmap, state to systems). Store rewritten for v2 paths. 7 new route files (roadmap, epics, milestones, releases, systems, labels, automations). Existing routes updated (issues, changelog, session, ideas, activity). AI tools updated. UI: new Systems view, API client expanded, notification tray, sidebar, and dashboard updated.

entries.title: Docs system, headless AI runner, automation engine, scheduler, project init
entries.description: Full Doc entity wired end to end (store CRUD, route CRUD, 5 AI tools). Headless AI agent runner for programmatic task execution (premium model routing, 20-iteration tool loop). Automation engine with trigger evaluation, condition checking, AI-driven execution. 60s interval scheduler for daily/weekly crons. 5 built-in automations (session audit, change tracker, nightly audit, weekly report, docs refresh). Trigger hooks in watcher/session/roadmap/issues. Project init: POST /api/v1/init scans codebase + git + README and runs AI agent to populate all entities. 4 new premium task types in model router.

entries.title: Nightly system audit — health reassessment, idea triage, stale data cleanup
entries.description: Automated nightly audit: reassessed all 11 system health scores (2 degraded: CLI 50%, Integrations 45%). Updated 3 open issues with current assessment notes. Promoted 5 ideas to backlog, dismissed 1 (open source contradicts paid product decision), validated 2, elevated 2 to critical/exploring. Refreshed stale context recovery. Triggered fresh codebase scan (59→96 files, 10K→19K lines). Updated project state summary. Overall health: 76%→74%.

entries.title: Weekly progress report automation — Week 1 (Feb 3–9, 2026)
entries.description: Automated weekly progress report generated. Key findings: 54 items shipped across 5 logged sessions (22.5h), 161 story points, 84% issue resolution rate (16/19). 3 open issues (ISS-003, ISS-006, ISS-012) — all architectural. 3 degraded systems (CLI, Integrations, Cursor Rule). Data integrity gap identified: sessions 6–7 missing from velocity log. Recommended focus for next week: battle-test AI chat, dogfood on Pillar, build AI watcher.

entries.title: Weekly progress report automation — Week 1 (Feb 3–9, 2026) [Updated]
entries.description: Updated weekly progress report (BN-019). Key changes from previous report: ISS-020 identified (velocity data gap, sessions 6–7 missing), open issues now 4 (was 3). Comprehensive analysis: 54 tracked items shipped / ~65-70 estimated actual, 161 story points, 22.5h across 5 sessions, 80% issue resolution rate (16/20). 3 degraded systems (CLI, Integrations, Cursor Rule). #1 focus for next week: battle-test AI chat in browser — blocks everything downstream. Automation triggered by scheduled docs-refresh.

entries.title: Weekly progress report automation — Week 2 (Feb 10–16, 2026)
entries.description: Automated weekly progress report (BN-020). Key finding: ZERO ACTIVITY WEEK — no sessions, no commits, no changelog entries since Feb 8. Velocity dropped from 54 items/161pts (Week 1) to 0/0 (Week 2). All 4 open issues unchanged and aging (8-9 days old). 3 degraded systems unchanged. All Week 1 focus recommendations carried forward unaddressed. #1 priority remains: battle-test AI chat in browser. Project is in a "built but unvalidated" state — significant infrastructure exists but nothing has been proven in real use.

entries.title: Session 8 audit — 3 issues, 4 ideas, 6 roadmap promotions, data capture from conversation
entries.description: Full conversation audit. Created ISS-023 (roadmap expand broken), ISS-024 (no activity log in UI), ISS-025 (docs page blank). 4 new ideas: IDEA-050 (model delegation), IDEA-051 (AI memory cache), IDEA-052 (entity grouping), IDEA-053 (smart archival). Promoted 4 ideas to roadmap: automation-settings-ui (now), entity-provenance, activity-log-ui, brain-note-dedup, headless-runner-logging, ai-memory-cache. Updated archival-system to content-aware approach. Updated IDEA-043 to 3-label provenance system.

entries.title: Docs page fixed — wired to registry API, shows all 14 auto-generated docs
entries.description: Rewrote Docs.tsx to use the new registry API (GET /api/v1/docs) instead of legacy /docs/designs and /docs/decisions endpoints. Added docs.list(), docs.get(), docs.create(), docs.update(), docs.remove(), docs.regenerate() to API client. Docs now grouped by category (Guides & Reference, Systems, Design Docs). Auto-selects system-overview on load. Shows auto-generated badge, system tags, last updated date. Resolves ISS-025.

entries.title: Automation settings UI — full controls in Settings page
entries.description: Added complete Automations section to Settings AI Configuration tab: master kill switch with active/off badge, scheduler toggle, event triggers toggle, model tier selector (budget/standard/premium), cooldown config, max concurrent setting. Budget status with current spend display and reset button. Lists all 5 registered automations with individual toggles, trigger types, descriptions, last fired dates, run counts. Added aiConfig API client. Resolves ISS-021.

entries.title: Automations re-enabled — budget reset, all switches flipped on
entries.description: Re-enabled automations: master switch ON, scheduler ON, triggers ON. Model tier set to standard (Sonnet-level). Budget reset to $0 spent, daily limit raised to $10 with $7 warning. Cooldown remains 60 minutes between automation runs.

entries.title: Backlog cards now fully expandable with rich detail — ISS-023 resolved
entries.description: Complete rewrite of BacklogCard expanded section. Clicking any card now shows: full summary, metadata grid (type, epic, milestone, spawned_from, assignee, estimated sessions), related issues, dependencies, design doc link, tags, acceptance criteria list, AI notes with purple highlight, and created/modified/started/completed timestamps. Added expand/collapse chevron indicator and cursor pointer for discoverability.

entries.title: Rich tool call tray in AI chat — Pillar-style entity cards — ISS-027 resolved
entries.description: Replaced raw JSON tool call display with rich interactive cards in ChatSidebar. Create operations (ideas, issues, backlog) show formatted entity cards with ID, severity/priority badges, title, and description. List operations show item counts with expandable rows. Update/resolve operations show entity changes. Duplicate prevention shows yellow warning cards. Tool results now persist with messages (toolResults field on ChatMessage). Streaming shows animated status pills. Icons and colors per tool type.

entries.title: Entity dedup in AI create tools — ISS-026 resolved
entries.description: Added deduplication checks to all three AI entity create tools: capture_idea, create_issue, create_backlog_item. Uses title normalization (lowercase, strip punctuation), word overlap (70% threshold), and containment matching. When a duplicate is detected, returns the existing entity with a clear message to use the update tool instead. Prevents the duplicate IDEA creation problem observed in session 8.

entries.title: Timestamps visible on all entity cards — ISS-028 resolved
entries.description: Added created/modified timestamps to: Backlog expanded cards (created, modified, started, completed dates), Issues detail panel (discovered + resolved dates, plus notes and related backlog item), Ideas detail panel (created + modified dates, plus priority badge and tags). Across all entity views, users can now see when items were created and last touched.

entries.title: AI tool write tracking fix — prevent automation feedback loops (ISS-029)
entries.description: Refactored ideas.ts to use the store instead of direct fs.writeFileSync. Added store.markWrite() calls to brain.ts and profiles.ts. All AI tool writes now go through the store's write-tracking system so the file watcher correctly ignores them as internal writes, preventing potential infinite feedback loops when automations are active.

entries.title: Settings UI audit — trigger badges, Reset Spend, Max Concurrent (ISS-030, ISS-031, ISS-032)
entries.description: Fixed automation trigger badges showing 'manual' for everything — now displays actual trigger type (scheduled, session ended, item completed) with proper color coding. Fixed Reset Spend button to actually persist via API call. Marked Max Concurrent as 'coming soon' since the engine doesn't enforce it.

entries.title: Activity Log sidebar tab — Landmark-style timeline with provenance tracking (ISS-024)
entries.description: Built Activity Log as a new tab in the right sidebar alongside Chat. Landmark-inspired timeline design: date grouping (Today/Yesterday/date), colored timeline dots per event type (created=green, issue=red, idea=yellow, automation=purple), actor provenance badges (You/DevTrack/Automation/External), entity type + ID chips, expandable metadata (trigger type, duration, severity, horizon). Filterable by actor (All/User/DevTrack/System) and entity type. Polls every 15s for live updates. Skeleton loading states. Resolves ISS-024.

entries.title: Backfilled sessions 6 and 7 — resolves velocity data gap (ISS-020)
entries.description: Reconstructed sessions 6 (Entity Model v2, 2.5h, 8 items, 35pts) and 7 (Infrastructure, 3.5h, 15 items, 55pts) from activity feed ACT-0001–ACT-0017, changelog CL-043/CL-044, and cursor rule briefing. Updated velocity totals: 77 items / 251 points across 7 sessions. Root cause: sessions were not formally ended through the API. Resolves ISS-020.

entries.title: Session-end audit — automation-settings-ui marked completed, ui-design-overhaul moved to next/pending
entries.description: Audit found automation-settings-ui was completed in session 8 (CL-051, ISS-021) but status was still pending. Updated to completed. UI design overhaul phase 2 has not started and is lower priority — moved from now/in_progress to next/pending to reflect reality.

entries.title: Session-end comprehensive audit — 6 corrections, 1 duplicate dismissed, system health updated
entries.description: Performed deep audit of all DevTrack data following session 8. Corrections made: (1) automation-settings-ui marked completed (was pending despite being shipped in CL-051), (2) ui-design-overhaul moved to next/pending (phase 2 not started), (3) IDEA-049 dismissed as duplicate of IDEA-048, (4) AI Intelligence health score 68%→65% (chat agent 9+ days untested), (5) Session Tracking health 72%→80% (ISS-020 resolved), (6) Cursor Rule health 60%→62% (context refreshed). Project state summary updated. Context recovery written for next session. 6 open issues confirmed as still relevant. 27 modified files uncommitted to git. #1 blocker unchanged: AI chat agent never browser-tested.

entries.title: Roadmap: Kanban / By Epic view toggle with full epic grouped list view
entries.description: Added view mode toggle (Kanban / By Epic) to Roadmap page header with localStorage persistence. By Epic view shows items grouped under their parent epic with collapsible sections, colored dots, status badges, thin progress bars (completed/total), inline epic editor, and an Ungrouped section for items without an epic. Epic management includes create epic modal with color palette, epic dropdown selector on every card (both Kanban and By Epic views), and inline edit for title/description/status/color.

entries.title: Ideas: By Group view with connected-component clustering + related_ideas chips
entries.description: Added Flat / By Group view toggle to Ideas page. By Group mode clusters ideas that share related_ideas connections using BFS graph walk to find connected components. Each cluster shows as a collapsible section with auto-extracted group name (from 'Future group:' note text or category). Related ideas shown as clickable chips in both the list cards and detail panel — clicking navigates to the linked idea. Expanded update_idea AI tool to support related_ideas, tags, pros, cons, and open_questions fields.

entries.title: Captured 3 future ideas (analytics, timeline, filtering) + roadmap item + design notes
entries.description: Captured IDEA-062 (analytics dashboard — velocity charts, burn rate), IDEA-063 (timeline/roadmap visualization), IDEA-064 (rich filtering/custom views) with full pros/cons/questions. Added analytics-dashboard roadmap item (next horizon, M size). Wrote BN-023 (dev-track vs Linear positioning) and BN-024 (Linear design reference standard) brain notes.

entries.title: Created 6 epics and assigned all 28 roadmap items — By Epic view is now fully populated
entries.description: Created 6 strategic epics: AI Intelligence Engine (P0, 5 items), Automation & Self-Healing (P0, 6 items), UI & Views (P1, 7 items), Data Integrity & Trust (P1, 2 items), Platform & Distribution (P2, 5 items), Codebase Intelligence (P2, 3 items). Every roadmap item (including completed ones) assigned to its natural epic via PATCH /api/v1/roadmap/:id. By Epic view now shows meaningful groupings with progress bars instead of a flat ungrouped list.

entries.title: Wired related_ideas links across 42 ideas — By Group view now shows 8 clusters
entries.description: Set related_ideas arrays on 42 ideas across 8 natural clusters: Codebase Understanding (4), AI Autonomy (3), Trust & Transparency (5), Session Intelligence (8), Business/Platform (3), Automation Hardening (8), Integrations & Costs (3), UI/UX (6), Analytics (3). Ideas By Group view now shows connected component clusters with auto-extracted group names instead of flat ungrouped list.

entries.title: Cross-entity linking: open issues now shown per epic in By Epic view
entries.description: By Epic view now fetches open issues and cross-references them to epics via the issue.roadmap_item -> item.epic_id chain. Each epic header shows a red badge with open issue count (e.g., '2 issues'). This turns the By Epic view from a simple list into a mini project dashboard where you can see blockers at a glance.

entries.title: AI tool coverage expansion: epics, milestones, releases, activity feed, full roadmap schema
entries.description: Created 4 new AI tool modules (epics.ts, milestones.ts, releases.ts, activity.ts) adding 13 new tools. Updated backlog tools with full RoadmapItem schema support (epic_id, milestone_id, type, priority, blocked_by, related_issues, spawned_from, acceptance_criteria, ai_notes, estimated_sessions). Updated AI system prompt with complete entity hierarchy documentation, UI view descriptions, and behavioral guidance for epic-aware operations. AI coverage went from 65% to ~95% of all entities.

entries.title: Interactive issue badges in By Epic view + epic context in Issues view
entries.description: Made the red issue badge in Roadmap By Epic view clickable (with stopPropagation) to expand an inline panel showing each blocking issue with severity, title, symptoms. Added epic context chips to the Issues view list and detail panel by mapping issue.roadmap_item through roadmap items to their epic.

entries.title: Audits tab - end-to-end automation transparency system
entries.description: Built the complete audit system across all layers: (1) Data model - AuditRun, AuditStep, AuditChange, AuditSuggestion types with index for fast listing. (2) Storage - per-run JSON files with rolling index, store methods for CRUD and stats. (3) AuditRecorder class that instruments the agent loop to capture thinking, tool calls, results, and auto-detect entity changes from mutating tools. (4) Runner hooks - optional recorder parameter passed through runAgent(). (5) Engine wiring - runAIAutomation creates recorder, passes to runner, finalizes on completion with change detection. (6) API routes - list/get/stats/suggestion-approval endpoints. (7) Rich UI - stats bar (runs/cost/changes/suggestions), trigger type and status filters, expandable run cards with collapsible sections for summary, changes made, suggestions with approve/dismiss, thinking chain with step-by-step timeline, tool calls with expandable args/results, cost breakdown. (8) AI tools - list_audit_runs, get_audit_run, get_audit_stats for chat agent. Created automation-audits epic with 7 roadmap items, all completed.

entries.title: Automation audits epic completed — full transparency into AI operations
entries.description: Completed the entire automation-audits epic (7 roadmap items shipped): data model with AuditRun/AuditStep/AuditChange/AuditSuggestion types, per-run JSON storage with rolling index, AuditRecorder class that instruments the agent loop to capture thinking/tool calls/results, engine wiring with automatic change detection, REST API routes for list/get/stats/suggestions, rich UI with stats bar, filters, expandable run cards showing full audit trail, and AI tools for querying past runs. This delivers complete transparency into what DevTrack AI does autonomously. Every automation run now produces a visible audit card showing: summary, changes made, suggestions with approve/dismiss, thinking chain with step timeline, tool calls with args/results, cost breakdown. Epic marked completed with 88% progress (7/8 items, parent item was umbrella).

entries.title: Identified root cause of ISS-035 — AI config save uses shallow merge
entries.description: PUT /api/v1/ai/config uses Object.assign() which is a shallow merge. When the UI sends partial nested updates like { automations: { cooldown_minutes: 5 } }, Object.assign replaces the entire automations object, losing all other properties (enabled, scheduler_enabled, triggers_enabled, etc.). This explains why settings appear to save but don't persist — they're being overwritten by incomplete objects. Fix requires either: (1) deep merge in API route, or (2) UI sends full config object on save.

entries.title: Identified root cause of ISS-035 — AI config save uses shallow merge
entries.description: PUT /api/v1/ai/config uses Object.assign() which is a shallow merge. When the UI sends partial nested updates like { automations: { cooldown_minutes: 5 } }, Object.assign replaces the entire automations object, losing all other properties (enabled, scheduler_enabled, triggers_enabled, etc.). This explains why settings appear to save but don't persist — they're being overwritten by incomplete objects. Fix requires either: (1) deep merge in API route, or (2) UI sends full config object on save.

entries.title: Audits tab — markdown rendering, time filters, analytics charts, right sidebar breakdown
entries.description: Fixed summary truncation (recorder now stores full agent response, not mangled 500-char sentence split). Added ReactMarkdown + audit-markdown CSS for proper heading/list/code rendering. Added time range filters (Today/7d/30d/All time). Built collapsible analytics panel with muted Linear-style cost/runs bar chart and changes-by-action donut. Built right sidebar on run expand showing entity-type breakdown with action bars, change rows, and cost/performance stats. Added changes_by_action field to AuditRunIndex. Retroactively fixed run-0002 data.

entries.title: Chat agent — system prompt scope boundaries, agent activity panel, session changes tray
entries.description: Three chat improvements: (1) Added Scope & Boundaries section to system prompt — agent now knows it's a project intelligence layer, not a code editor. Investigates and creates rich entities as handoff artifacts. (2) Replaced simple ToolCallPill with AgentActivityPanel showing real-time tool visibility: status header, step counter, file paths, entity IDs, checkmarks for completed tools. (3) Built Pillar-style SessionChangesTray above input area — accumulates entity mutations from tool results during the session, grouped by entity type with action colors. ISS-036, ISS-037, ISS-038 resolved.

entries.title: Fixed ISS-035 (deep merge) + ISS-039 (WebSocket remount) + config cache + view persistence
entries.description: Four bug fixes: (1) ISS-035: Replaced Object.assign shallow merge with recursive deepMerge in PUT /ai/config — nested properties now preserved. (2) ISS-039 (critical): Removed refreshKey pattern from App.tsx that caused every WebSocket event to unmount/remount the entire active view, destroying all internal state. (3) Added reloadConfig() to AI service so GET /ai/config returns fresh data after PUT writes. (4) Persisted active view and Settings section to localStorage — survives page refresh.

entries.title: Manual 'Run Now' button on automations — bypass cooldown for immediate execution
entries.description: Added forceRun() method to AutomationEngine that bypasses cooldown check. Updated POST /automations/:id/fire to accept { force: true } body parameter. Added 'Run Now' button to each automation card in Settings > AI Configuration with spinner state and auto-refresh of automation list after firing. API client updated with automations.fire() method.

entries.title: Docs tab restructured — wiki + design docs, Initialize/Update buttons, route fix
entries.description: Rewrote Docs.tsx with: (1) Top header bar with Initialize/Update Docs buttons that trigger the docs-refresh automation with force bypass. (2) Design docs from data/designs/ shown in left nav under 'Design Docs' section alongside wiki docs. (3) Docs grouped into Guides, Systems, and Design Docs categories. (4) Fixed Hono route ordering bug — legacy /designs and /decisions routes were shadowed by /:id dynamic route. Moved legacy routes before /:id. (5) AI-generated badge, page counts, last-updated timestamps in header.

entries.title: Docs AI generation pipeline — Initialize and Update modes with audit recording
entries.description: Built POST /api/v1/docs/generate endpoint with two modes: (1) Initialize — deep codebase scan, reads all source files, systems, roadmap, issues, changelog, sessions, git log, then generates comprehensive wiki content for every doc in the registry. 30 iteration max, premium model. (2) Update — incremental scan of recent changes, updates only stale docs. 15 iteration max, standard model. Both modes use AuditRecorder for full visibility in the Audits tab, track cost to budget, and broadcast WebSocket events on completion. Route ordering fixed — /generate placed before /:id to prevent Hono shadowing. API client updated with docs.generate() method. UI buttons wire through to this endpoint with polling for live updates.

entries.title: AI rate limiting — retry with exponential backoff + preemptive token rate tracking
entries.description: Three-layer rate limit protection: (1) withRetry() wrapper with exponential backoff (5s/15s/45s) on 429 errors, applied to all provider API calls (OpenAI complete/stream, Anthropic complete/stream, Google complete). Respects retry-after headers when available. (2) TokenRateTracker class with per-provider sliding window (60s) that tracks input tokens and preemptively delays requests when approaching known limits (Anthropic: 400K buffer of 450K limit). (3) Token estimation in complete() method using rough 4-chars-per-token heuristic for preemptive checks. ISS-040 resolved.

entries.title: Multi-user prep — personal data separation, gitignore setup, profile migration
entries.description: Separated personal vs project data for multi-user support. Created data/local/ directory (gitignored) for user-specific data. Moved profiles.json from data/ai/ to data/local/ with automatic migration — code checks for existing profiles at old path and copies to new on first access. Updated all profile references: routes/ai.ts (3 endpoints), ai/chat.ts (system prompt injection), ai/tools/profiles.ts (AI tool), project-config.ts (init defaults). Added getLocalDataDir() helper to project-config.ts. Updated .gitignore to exclude data/local/ and data/ai/conversations/. Credentials (.credentials.json) was already gitignored. Project data (roadmap, issues, docs, config, etc.) remains committed for git-based collaboration.

entries.title: Helicone enrichment — custom properties on all AI requests (user, session, automation)
entries.description: Added heliconeProperties field to AICompletionOptions. Builds Helicone-Property-* headers from the properties map. Chat requests include Source=chat, ConversationId, User. Automation requests include Source=automation, AutomationId, AutomationName, Trigger. Task type always included. Headers injected into both OpenAI and Anthropic API calls via per-request options. Runner passes properties through from caller. Enables per-user cost tracking, session attribution, and automation cost breakdown in Helicone dashboard.

entries.title: Doc generation model routing fix + tool description improvements
entries.description: Changed doc_generation task route from premium-first to standard-first (Sonnet default, Opus via model override). Initialize mode will explicitly pass Opus 4.5 model ID. Rewrote update_doc tool: content parameter now REQUIRED (was optional), description explains it must be full markdown text, added validation that rejects empty/short content with clear error message. Prevents the $14 tool-fumbling waste from the first docs run.

entries.title: AI State Cache — compressed project summary for efficient agent context
entries.description: New server/ai/state-cache.ts module. buildStateCache() reads all store data and compresses into ~2-5K token summary: project health, systems with scores, roadmap by horizon, open issues, recent changelog, velocity stats, docs status, active session. 30-minute TTL with memory + disk caching. getStateCache() returns fresh or cached. formatStateCacheForPrompt() outputs ready-to-inject text block. Replaces 130K+ token raw context building in automations and docs generator. Foundation for tiered audit system (IDEA-069).

entries.title: Hybrid docs generation: monolithic Opus 4.5 init + per-doc Sonnet updates + progress tracking
entries.description: Complete rewrite of docs generation architecture. Initialize mode: monolithic Opus 4.5 agent (force model claude-opus-4-5-20251101 for Helicone cost tracking), 20 iterations, state cache context, resumability via completed_docs tracking. Update mode: per-doc Sonnet coordinator that loops through stale auto-generated docs, spawns focused 5-iteration agent per doc, atomic (server restart loses at most 1 doc). Both modes: generation status tracking (running/completed/errors/cost in module-level state + data/ai/docs-generation-status.json), GET /docs/generate/status endpoint, conflict prevention (409 if already running). UI: real-time progress bar in Docs tab header (polls every 3s), shows doc count, current doc name, running cost. Dashboard: Initialize Project + Generate Docs buttons. Init flow (POST /init) now triggers docs generation as final step. State cache wired into automation engine replacing raw 130K token context building.
